title: The race to sequence the human genome - Tien Nguyen

multiple-choice.question: What is packed inside every cell in the human body?

options.label: A
options.text: A set of genetic instructions, 3.2 billion base pairs long.

options.label: B
options.text: A set of genetic instructions, 3.2 billion base pairs short.

options.label: C
options.text: A set of genetic instructions, 3.2 billion base pairs average.

options.label: D
options.text: A set of genetic instructions, 3.2 billion base pairs unknown.

multiple-choice.question: What was the goal of the Human Genome Project?

options.label: A
options.text: To sequence the entire human genome in 15 years with $3 billion of public funds.

options.label: B
options.text: To sequence the entire human genome in 3 years with $3 billion of public funds.

options.label: C
options.text: To sequence the entire human genome in 15 years with $1 billion of public funds.

options.label: D
options.text: To sequence the entire human genome in 3 years with $1 billion of public funds.

multiple-choice.question: What was the strategy used by Celera to sequence the human genome?

options.label: C
options.text: Both hierarchical shotgun sequencing and whole genome shotgun sequencing.

options.label: D
options.text: Neither hierarchical shotgun sequencing nor whole genome shotgun sequencing.

multiple-choice.question: What was the result of the Human Genome Project's approach to sequencing the genome?

options.label: A
options.text: A contiguous map of the genome was created in just six years.

options.label: B
options.text: A contiguous map of the genome was created in just three years.

options.label: C
options.text: A contiguous map of the genome was not created.

options.label: D
options.text: A contiguous map of the genome was created in just one year.

multiple-choice.question: What was the result of the Celera's approach to sequencing the genome?

options.label: A
options.text: A contiguous map of the genome was created in just three years.

options.label: B
options.text: A contiguous map of the genome was not created.

options.label: C
options.text: A contiguous map of the genome was created in just one year.

options.label: D
options.text: A contiguous map of the genome was created in just six years.

multiple-choice.question: What was the outcome of the competition between the Human Genome Project and Celera?

options.label: A
options.text: The Human Genome Project won the competition.

options.label: C
options.text: Both the Human Genome Project and Celera won the competition.

options.label: D
options.text: Neither the Human Genome Project nor Celera won the competition.

multiple-choice.question: What was the unusual approach of the Human Genome Project?

options.label: A
options.text: The Human Genome Project closely guarded its data until it was able to analyze it and publish its conclusions.

options.label: B
options.text: The Human Genome Project immediately shared its data with the public.

options.label: C
options.text: The Human Genome Project shared its data with only a few select researchers.

options.label: D
options.text: The Human Genome Project did not share its data with anyone.

multiple-choice.question: What has been the result of the Human Genome Project's approach to share its data?

options.label: A
options.text: The pace of research has slowed down.

options.label: B
options.text: The pace of research has accelerated.

options.label: C
options.text: The pace of research has remained the same.

options.label: D
options.text: The pace of research has stopped.

multiple-choice.question: How long does it take to sequence a person's genome today?
What are some of the challenges for the next generation of research initiatives?

options.label: A
options.text: Understanding what most of our genes do and how they are controlled.

options.label: B
options.text: Understanding what most of our genes do and how they are not controlled.

options.label: C
options.text: Understanding what most of our genes do and how they are controlled in other species.

options.label: D
options.text: Understanding what most of our genes do and how they are not controlled in other species.

title: 3 tips to boost your confidence - TED-Ed

multiple-choice.question: What is confidence?

options.label: A
options.text: A feeling of being scared of challenges.

options.label: B
options.text: A belief that you are valuable, worthwhile, and capable.

options.label: D
options.text: A feeling of being overwhelmed by tasks.

multiple-choice.question: What are the three factors that impact confidence?

options.label: A
options.text: Only what you're born with and how you're treated.

options.label: B
options.text: Only the part you have control over and the choices you make.

options.label: C
options.text: What you're born with, how you're treated, and the part you have control over and the choices you make.

multiple-choice.question: What is a growth mindset?

options.label: A
options.text: The belief that your talents are fixed at birth.

options.label: B
options.text: The belief that your abilities can improve with study and practice.

options.label: C
options.text: The belief that you are not capable of learning new things.

options.label: D
options.text: The belief that you are already an expert in everything.

multiple-choice.question: What is the benefit of having a growth mindset?

options.label: A
options.text: You are more likely to give up when faced with challenges.

options.label: B
options.text: You are more likely to respond to challenges and setbacks in a constructive way.

options.label: C
options.text: You are more likely to be successful, but only in easy tasks.

options.label: D
options.text: You are more likely to be successful, getting better grades, and doing better in the face of challenges.

multiple-choice.question: What is the benefit of practicing failure?

options.label: C
options.text: You will learn how to try different strategies, ask others for advice, and persevere.

options.label: D
options.text: You will give up easily when faced with challenges.

multiple-choice.question: What is the benefit of facing challenges with a growth mindset?

options.label: A
options.text: You will never feel excited about taking on new challenges.

options.label: B
options.text: You will always feel anxious about taking on new challenges.

options.label: C
options.text: You will learn how to try different strategies, ask others for advice, and persevere.

multiple-choice.question: What is the benefit of having confidence?

options.label: A
options.text: You will always feel scared of challenges.

options.label: C
options.text: You will be able to turn thoughts into action.

options.label: D
options.text: You will always feel overwhelmed by tasks.

multiple-choice.question: What is the benefit of having a quick fix for confidence?

options.label: C
options.text: You will have an immediate confidence boost in the short term.

multiple-choice.question: What is the benefit of believing in your ability to improve?

options.label: B
options.text: You will always feel anxious about taking on new challenges.

options.label: C
options.text: You will believe that your abilities can improve with study and practice.

multiple-choice.question: What is the benefit of being kind to yourself when you make mistakes?

options.label: A
options.text: You will always feel anxious about taking on new challenges.

options.label: C
options.text: You will learn how to try different strategies, ask others for advice, and persevere.

options.text: Mountain streams are identical to the meandering rivers of the plains.

options.label: A
options.text: The stream becomes faster-moving and wider.

options.label: B
options.text: The stream becomes slower-moving and narrower.

options.label: C
options.text: The bank weakens and eventually crumbles into the stream.

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: The flow on the other side of the channel remains unchanged.

options.label: B
options.text: The water becomes faster-moving and narrower.

options.label: C
options.text: The length of one S-shaped meander tends to be about 9 times the width of the channel.

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: The river becomes wider and faster-moving.

options.label: D
options.text: The river becomes narrower and slower-moving.

options.label: D
